Title: As an anonymous person, I can see the homepage (root path) with a registration button
As an anonymous person, I can click the registration button and view a registration form
Description: This form has an input field for my username, password and a submit button that does nothing yet.

Title: As an anonymous person, I can fill out the registration form to create an account
Description:
When submitting the form, I should see "Thank you for registering"

This message should go away when I refresh the page.

Title: As an anonymous person, when I'm on the homepage, I can click "Login", fill in my username and password, and log in
Description: When a user submits the form they should be redirected to the home page and see the text "Welcome, #{username}"

Title: As a logged in user, I no longer see the "Login" or "Registration" button, but instead "Logout"
As a logged in user, when I click "Logout", I am logged out
Description: Clicking log will bring the user back to the homepage. They should see the "Login" and "Register" buttons. The welcome message is gone.

Title: As an anonymous person, If I fill in an empty username OR an empty password OR both, I see a message informing me that I need to fill in that information
Description:
"Username is required"
OR
"Password is required"
OR
"Username and password is required"

is presented above the form

If you're feeling daring. Try using Database Constraints to implement this. You'll have to rescue the exception thrown by the Database class.

Title: As a anonymous user, I cannot register with a username that already exists
Description:
I see a message informing me that this username is already taken.

Try using a database constraint and rescue the exception thrown by the Database class.

Look up

```
begin
  # do stuff
rescue
  # something bad happened, do something else
end
```

Title: As a logged in user, I can view a list of users on my homepage
Description: This ONLY shows up for logged in users, User's that are not logged in do not see the list

Title: As a logged in user, I don't see myself on the list of users
As a logged in user, I can order the users by username
As a logged in user, I can delete other users
As a logged in User, I can create a fish with a wikipedia page
Description: Any logged in user can see all fish on the homepage

Title: As a logged in user, I can only view fish created by myself on the homepage
Description: A logged in user can no longer see fish created by other users

Title: Exercise Goal
As a logged in user, I can click on another user's name and view fish created by them
As a logged in user, when I click "Favorite" next to another user's fish then I can favorite fish.
Description: There is a link next to the fish that reads "Favorite", when I've favorited a fish, this link turns to text that states "Favorited"

Title: As a logged in user, when I click "Favorited" then I can un-favorite a fish I've favorited
As a logged in user, I can delete fish created by myself
Description: I cannot delete other user's fish

Title: As a logged in user, when I click "Search Fish" from the homepage and I fill out a search form and submit I can see fish name's that match the search
Description: Look up how to use a wildcard like query in SQL.

Title: Extended Goal
As a logged in user, when I view another user's fish and I click "Add Fish to my Collection" then the fish is added to my list of fish
Description: Don't make a duplicate copy of the fish

Title: As a logged in user, when I view another user's fish and I click "Comment", fill out a comment form and submit the form then I see my comment beneath the fish on the user's list of fish
As a logged in user, when another user comments on my fish, then I see that comment beneath the correct fish on the homepage
As a logged in user, when I view another user's comment and I click "Spam" then the comment is marked as "Spam"
Description: A "Spam" comment shows up in RED

Title: As a logged in user, when I'm viewing my home page and I have a comment that's been marked as spam then I see a new section called "Spam" that has a list of all of my comments that have been marked as spam
Description: The "Spam" section on my homepage ONLY shows up if I have at least one spammy comment.

Title: Life Goal
